headline: How Regulatory Approval for Amazon Data Center Powerlines at PPL (PPL) Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: PPL recently received approval from the Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission to begin construction on three powerlines serving Amazon’s planned data center near Salem Township, with waivers granted to allow work to start in October and completion targeted for April 2028. This regulatory milestone highlights PPL’s growing role in powering large-scale data centers, signaling strengthening utility demand from technology sector clients. We’ll now explore how regulatory approval of new...
